page.title: 08The school
page.content: An Interview with Miss Smith,a former headteacher. Miss Smith has been retired for several years now but she still lives in a house next to the school. She remembers the time when she first became headteacher in 1939. The playground was a surface of ashes covered in shingle. The school had four gardens divided by paths and apple trees. There were only eight boys in the school then so two looked after each garden. There were no school dinners and most of the children went home at lunchtime but some could not so they had a hunk of bread and lard and some hot cocoa in the winter which was made at the school.
